intro: Chelonanthera sulphurea, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble small stars, hence its common name. It typically grows as a trailing or climbing plant, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
